clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Mechanisms Underlying SARS-CoV-2 Infection and the Impact of COVID-19 on Cognitive Function
clinical_study.official_title: Genetic Mechanisms Underlying SARS-CoV-2 Infection and the Impact of COVID-19 on Cognitive Function

brief_summary.textblock: There is a considerable variation in the disease behavior in terms of contracting the infection, manifesting none to a range of symptoms and severity of the infection among individuals exposed to or infected with SARS-CoV-2 virus, the causative organism of COVID-19. Although the respiratory system appears to be the primary target of this virus infection, emerging evidences suggests involvement of extra-pulmonary organs including central nervous system. We aim to compare the genetic profile of individuals with vs without COVID-19 after being exposed to infected cases. Additionally, we will assess the cognitive function in covid-19 positive cases with vs. without neurological symptoms at the time of infection and 1-month follow-up using the Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) questionnaire.

primary_outcome.measure: Genetic variants with vs without COVID-19
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate variants in the following known COVID-associated genes, ACE2R, IFITM, HLA-B 46, HLA-B 15, Toll Like Receptor and IFN-1, LIST, Perforin and mutations in Chromosome 3p21.31 along with novel genetic variants.
Assess the cognitive status at baseline using MoCA survey in patients with vs without neurological symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in cognitive function at 1 month
secondary_outcome.description: change in the MoCA score from baseline in patients with vs without neurological symptoms
compare the genetic variants in patients with no or mild to moderate vs severe symptoms

intervention.description: MoCA survey to evaluate cognitive function in COVID-19 positive cases with vs without neurological symptoms

study_pop.textblock: Known exposure to COVID-19 or confirmed cases of COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Male or female over 18 years of age at the time of enrollment
2. Have symptoms of COVID-19 (with or without hospitalization) or contact history
3. Willing to undergo nasopharyngeal swab test for viral-RNA at baseline (in non-hospitalized cases) and the MoCA survey at baseline and 1-month follow-up
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Unwilling to provide informed consent
